title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Skagit Regional Health
Interview Descriptions:
Quite long interview.  Almost an hour with 4 people at the same time, over Zoom call.  It went quite well and the staff was very friendly.  We hit it off and I felt great about the possibility of joining the team
Got an offer soon after which I was quite excited about, but I nearly choked when I saw the salary offered.  It was insultingly low and not at all comparative with similar positions elsewhere.  Tried to negotiate but it went nowhere so I declined.  Kept my temp job making $7 more per hour up the street.
Beware this company pays bottom of the barrel, unlivable wages for mid-level career jobs that require a lot of skill and knowledge.  If you want to be able to afford modest rent, look elsewhere.
Interview Questions: Multiple questions about my accounting knowledge

title: Medical Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Skagit Regional Health in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: I applied on Indeed and was invited to a Zoom interview. The interview was pretty straight forward and started on time. They opened time up for any questions. They said that they would follow up within a week with updates and none was received. No email/call to give feedback or advise that I wasn't selected.
Interview Questions: Standard questions like about yourself, why you are interested in the role, how soon are you looking to start, etc.

title: Human Resources Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Skagit Regional Health (Mount Vernon, WA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Remote process- all via phones, no video.  No follow up questions or opportunities to ask questions. I wasn’t asked about my qualifications or examples of when I demonstrated expertise skills.
Interview Questions: Why was I interested in working for their company?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Skagit Regional Health
Interview Descriptions: A lot of repetitive and typical questions pertaining to customer service. Questions about de-escalation experience are also highlighted. Knowledge about HIPAA and medical terminology is a plus. There are also questions pertaining to familiarity with the EPIC Electronic Health Record System.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a difficult patient?

title: Staff Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Skagit Regional Health (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was an online application.  Al lot of questions.  HR later emailed with more questions.  I never received a final decision as to whether or not I was a contender for the job and whether or not I was rejected.

title: HIM Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Skagit Regional Health (Mount Vernon, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Went into the manager’s room. Manager and supervisor asked questions about my experience for the position. The manager was very nice, the supervisor was okay. I believe they asked about 8 questions total. Took about 40 mins.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with medical records?

title: Referral Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Skagit Regional Health
Interview Descriptions: The initial online application then a phone interview/screening. I had two in-person interviews as well. The first was brief with the person who was to by my direct manager and then the second was a panel interview with the practice manager, front office manager, and an employee who was currently in the position I was interviewing for.
Interview Questions: Each interview I was asked a version of "How do you deal with difficult patients/situations"?

title: Insurance Authorization Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Skagit Regional Health (Mount Vernon, WA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with hiring manager. The met with supervisor and director of the department for a short meet and greet. My final interview was with supervisor and two managers from the department for extensive panel interview. This lasted for about an hour and a half. After the final interview, I received a phone call from the hiring manager offering me the position.
Interview Questions: Very general behavioral interview questions. What are you strengths and weakness? How do you handle a difficult coworker? Describe a situation you went above and beyond your job description.

title: Security Guard Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Skagit Regional Health in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty relaxed; the supervisors were very polite. I did the interview and a week later I found out I had the job. It wasn't that difficult of a interview, just be ready to answer questions regarding possible scenarios and and answer as honestly as possible.
Interview Questions: What would you do with hostile patient?

title: Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Skagit Regional Health (Mount Vernon, WA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Was asked questions that pertained to the job I had applied for, Very friendly duo that interviewed me. Had asked me questions about experience and personal interests. I felt very comfortable throughout the interviewing process. I was welcomed into a private room, and given a comfortable chair to sit in as the interviewers sat across from me making eye contact and smiling. They seemed cheerful and made me feel very welcome.
Interview Questions: What do you enjoy doing in your spare time, or have you any hobbies?
